author: pburba
msg: Fix a merge range notification bug.
Note: The change to merge.c includes some unintentional whitespace changes.
These were corrected in r30748 as part of an unrelated change.  This mess was
caused because I had both changes in my WC and committed them sequentially,
but missed the fact there where whitespace changes in the first commit.
Today's moral: Always have "compare whitespace" selected in TortoiseMerge!
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(find_nearest_ancestor): Don't consider a subtree path its own nearest
ancestor.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py
(merge_fails_if_subtree_is_deleted_on_src): Correct the expected merge
range.  Due to the bug in find_nearest_ancestor() when we merged -r1:5
from 'A' into 'A_COPY' we were getting a "--- Merging r5 into
'A_COPY/D/gamma'" header followed the deletion of A_COPY/D/gamma!  This
should be "--- Merging r3 through r5 into 'A_copy'" (A_copy was
copied from A@2).

author: pburba
msg: Fix bug when creating string representations of ranges X:Y where X > Y.
Note: We don't actually create string representations of reversed ranges so
this hasn't been a problem so far.  I only discovered it when using some
printf's and svn_rangelist_to_string's while debugging.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/mergeinfo.c
(range_to_string): Handle reversed svn_merge_range_t (START > END).  If
(START - 1) = END then create a string representation of START preceded
by "-".  Otherwise create a string representation of START, followed by
a "-", followed by a string representation of END + 1.

author: stsp
msg: On the dont-save-plaintext-passwords-by-default branch:
* subversion/include/svn_cmdline.h
(svn_cmdline_auth_plaintext_prompt): Does use baton argument
now, so remove contradicting statement in docstring (which in
hindsight should never have been there in the first place).
* subversion/libsvn_subr/config_file.c
(svn_config_ensure): Split a 160 characters long line into two.
Found by: Daniel Shahaf <d.s@daniel.shahaf.co.il>

author: kfogel
msg: Fix a memory leak in remove recursive propget.  See thread starting here:
http://subversion.tigris.org/servlets/ReadMsg?list=dev&msgNo=137529
From: "Peter Wemm" <peter@wemm.org>
To: dev@subversion.tigris.org
Subject: svn propget -R on the root of a large repository == boom!
Message-ID: <e7db6d980804210212h49b2a5a2g5b99093d2ec437a7@mail.gmail.com>
* subversion/libsvn_client/prop_commands.c
(remote_propget): Take perm_pool and work_pool arguments, instead of
just one pool, and use them to manage memory more efficiently.

author: stsp
msg: On the dont-save-plaintext-passwords-by-default branch,
revert use of SVN_INT_ERR.
* subversion/svn/main.c
(main): Exit via svn_cmdline_handle_exit_error if conversion to
UTF-8 fails. This avoids aborts in maintainer mode according to
the log message of r24415.
Exit via svn_handle_error2 with force == TRUE if setting up the
auth baton fails. I'm not convinced abort()ing is correct here,
but this is how it's currently done on trunk. No need to differ,
this branch isn't about cleaning up our exit behaviour.
